thread.title: Medibank Private chief George Savvides to step down 15 months earlier than planned | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
thread.title_full: Medibank Private chief George Savvides to step down 15 months earlier than planned | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Drew Cratchley
title: Medibank Private chief George Savvides to step down 15 months earlier than planned | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
text:
MEDIBANK Private’s chief executive of 13 years has brought forward his retirement plans and will leave the health insurer next March.
George Savvides said today that the time was right to hand over to a new generation, and he and the board had agreed to bring forward his expected retirement date by 15 months.
“I firmly believe that now is the time to give a new generation of leaders the opportunity to build on the strong platform that now exists,” Mr Savvides said.
A successor is expected to be appointed before his departure in March, with internal and external candidates to be considered.
Mr Savvides’ decision comes just under a year since Medibank became a publicly listed company following a $5.7 billion float by the Federal Government.
It means Medibank’s first annual meeting this morning was Mr Savvides’ first and last.
“I consider it an absolute privilege to have led the nation’s largest health insurer for more than 13 years,” he said.
“During this time the organisation has transitioned from a not-for-profit government business enterprise to a for-profit organisation and ultimately becoming a publicly listed company on the ASX.”
The health insurer has also reaffirmed its full-year financial forecast, targeting an operating profit above $370 million and premium revenue growth above 5.5 per cent.
Medibank shares were down 2 per cent in early trade at $2.50.
AAP
Originally published as Health insurance boss to step down
